result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael A. Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Michael A. Lewis.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Andrew Herrmann. Called @ 3:15 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 3rd status on 22CF328 and 10th status/BFH on 21CF241. Record by Atty. as to multiple resets of trial dates, and asks that matters be put back on trial calendar. Discussion as to order of cases. Matters will be heard back to back with  21CF241 to be tried first.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:37 AM 

Defendant Michael Lewis present in court, in custody with attorney Jeramiah Maynard. ADA Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim was personally served on June 15, unknown why she is not present right now. 
Defense is prepared.


Court resets before assigned court official.

8:56am Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael Lewis present in court, in custody via video with attorney Jeramiah Maynard. ADA Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. New global offer just received, Atty Maynard needs to discuss with ADA Berg but believes parties will reach resolution. Parties are confirming for trial at this time. Discovery is complete. State has 6 witnesses all served & available. Defense does not have any other witnesses other than potentially Deft. Court orders exclusion of witnesses subject to victim & court officer. Voir dire- 2 alternates, 5 strikes each. Jurors may take notes, jurors may not ask questions. Atty Maynard to arrange civilian clothing for Deft. State to e-file jury instructions the Friday before trial.
Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

3:40PM - (64-06) Defendant Michael A. Lewis appeared by video.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Michael A. Lewis. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Maynard acknowledged the receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial reserved.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael A. Lewis in court, in custody by video.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Michael A. Lewis. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Maynard. Argument, granted. Rights given and preliminary rights given. Time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jeremiah Maynard
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDMENT 6-20-2022: Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.C. OR RESIDENCE IF RELEASED. ELECTRONIC CONTACT ONLY WHILE IN CUSTODY. 

BOND TO COVER 22CF328 & 21CF241

DEFENDANT MUST POST $1000 (VICTIM L.C. IS NOT ALLOWED TO POST)

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.C. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Michael A Lewis in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maynard for defendant. Court will not allow victim to post bond money. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
